snippet: A new law in Russia restricts beer sales at train stations and sidewalk kiosks, but some are uncertain that overall alcohol consumption will decrease.
abstract: Moscow Journal; new law in Russia intended to address country's high rates of alcoholism restricts beer sales at train stations and sidewalk kiosks, but some are uncertain that overall alcohol consumption will decrease; Russia has one of world's highest rates of alcoholism and alcohol-related illness.
lead_paragraph: A new law in Russia restricts beer sales at train stations and sidewalk kiosks, but some are uncertain that overall alcohol consumption will decrease.

headline.seo: Russian Beer Law Draws Support, and Some Pessimism
headline.main: New Beer Law Draws Cautious Support, With Notes of Pessimism
headline.print_headline: New Beer Law Draws Cautious Support, With Notes of Pessimism
